intro: Astragalus menziesii subsp. virgatus, commonly known as the Sierra Calkins or western milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its slender stems and small, yellow pea-like flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its hairy leaves and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife. The plant is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
